Class Actions

  • java.lang.Object
    • bll.Actions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDeliveryServiceProcessing

    public class Actions
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDeliveryServiceProcessing
    The purpose of this class is to implement methods of an interface in order to do all actions available
    Author:
    Szekely Maria-Robertha
    See Also:
    IDeliveryServiceProcessing

      The purpose of the method is to create a new product using datas from certain JTextfields from the interface, add it into a map, and write it into a file
      void btwSEHour(java.lang.String start, java.lang.String end)
      The purpose of the method is to generate a report which contains filtered orders by a start and an end hour provided from the interface
      boolean checkParsable(java.lang.String s)
      The purpose of the method is to check if the user entered the correct data in the JTextfields on the interface
      void clientsOrderedMoreThan(java.lang.String number, java.lang.String value)
      The purpose of the method is to generate a report which contains the clients that have ordered more than a specified number of times so far and the value of the order was higher than a specified amount
      void copyData(java.io.File file1, java.io.File file2)
      This method is used when the admin is trying to delete an existing product The old file which contains the old data must be replaced with a new one which contain new data about the deleted product
      void createComposite(CompositeProduct cp)
      The purpose of the method is to create a composite product using Composite Design Pattern from a list of base products, add it into a map, and write it into a file
      void createOrder(java.lang.String name, java.util.List<MenuItem> toOrder)
      The purpose of the method is to create an order composed of a name (a hashcode) and a list of items which has been ordered through this order
      void deleteProduct(javax.swing.JComboBox<java.lang.String> products)
      The purpose of the method is to delete a product (chosen from the interface through a JComboBox) from a map and a file
      void importProducts()
      The purpose of the method is to import data from a .csv file using lambda expressions
      void modifyProduct(javax.swing.JComboBox<java.lang.String> products, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String rating, java.lang.String calories, java.lang.String proteins, java.lang.String fat, java.lang.String sodium, java.lang.String price)
      The purpose of the method is to modify an existing product (chosen from the interface through a JComboBox) with datas read from certain JTexfields from the intrface
      void productsOrderedMoreThan(java.lang.String number)
      The purpose of the method is to generate a report which contains the products ordered more than a specified number of times so far
      void searchProduct(java.lang.String filter, int fr)
      The purpose of the method is to create a search (filter) system to find products that contain certain words or any char sequence It also sort the product list depending on certain keywords such as "rating, calories, fat, etc."
      void specifiedDay(java.lang.String day)
      The purpose of the method is to generate a report which contains the products ordered within a specified day with the number of times they have been ordered

      • searchProduct

        public void searchProduct(java.lang.String filter,
                          int fr)
        The purpose of the method is to create a search (filter) system to find products that contain certain words or any char sequence It also sort the product list depending on certain keywords such as "rating, calories, fat, etc."
        Specified by:
        searchProduct in interface IDeliveryServiceProcessing
        Parameters:
        filter - represents the filter (char sequence) after which the search will be made
        fr - can be 1 or 0 depending on where the method is called
        See Also:
        The method also calls another method that writes into a file the order's details using serialization, Writer, Serializable

      • checkParsable

        public boolean checkParsable(java.lang.String s)
        The purpose of the method is to check if the user entered the correct data in the JTextfields on the interface
        Parameters:
        s - represent which string shoul be checked
        Returns:
        true if the string is parsable to Float, false if the string isn't parsable to Float

      • copyData

        public void copyData(java.io.File file1,
                     java.io.File file2)
        This method is used when the admin is trying to delete an existing product The old file which contains the old data must be replaced with a new one which contain new data about the deleted product
        Parameters:
        file1 - represents the new file
        file2 - represent the old file
